ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS 1 Fast Plasma Investigation, Dual Electron Spectrometer (FPI, DES) Partial Distribution Moments, Level 2 (L2), Burst Mode, 30 ms Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: FPI usually operates in Fast Survey (FS) Mode in the MMS Region Of Interest (ROI) for the current Mission Phase. Data are taken at Burst (30/150 ms for DES/DIS) Resolution in this Mode. Data are also made available at Survey (4.5 s, etc.) Resolution. Per Mission Design, not all Burst Resolution Data are downlinked, but all Survey Data are downlinked. Planning around Calibration Activities, avoidance of Earth Radiation Belts, etc., when possible, FPI usually operates in Slow Survey (SS) Mode (60 s Resolution) outside of ROI, and then only the 60 s Resolution Survey Data are available. This Product contains Partial Moments that come from performing the Standard Moment Integrals over a limited Portion of Velocity Space. The resulting Quantities are named similarly to their corresponding Standard Moments, but are decorated with 'part' to differentiate. For example, density_part is the Density Moment integrated from a particular Energy Step to Infinity. These Partial Moments are formed from the indicated Data Type (DES/DIS Burst, FS or SS). For convenience, some additional Parameters are included to augment those most commonly found in a Moments Product of this sort, plus Time Stamps and other Annotation characterizing the State of the Instrument System at the indicated Time.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time Tags
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tags, Terrestrial Time in Nanoseconds since J2000, Reference Position given by the rotating Earth Geoid
Parameter.Caveats: Burst Data Begin Time derived from the Burst Packet Time This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Error Flags
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Vector of Data Quality Flag Indicators at the Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/saturation Effects likely present in Skymap, Bit-2=Reported Spacecraft Potential above 20 V, Bit-3=Invalid/unavailable Spacecraft Potential, Bit-4=Significant (>10%) Cold Plasma (<10 eV) Component, Bit-5=Significant (>25%) Hot Plasma (>30 keV) Component, Bit-6=High Sonic Mach Number (v/vth>2.5), Bit-7=Low calculated Density (n_DES<0.05 cm^-3), Bit-8=Bent Pipe Magnetic Field used instead of Brst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-9=Srvy l2pre Magnetic Field used instead of Brst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-10=No internally generated Photoelectron Correction applied, Bit-11=Compression Pipeline Error, Bit-12=Spintone Calculation Error, DBCS only

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Number Density
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Partial Electron Number Density during this Burst

Parameter.Name: DBCS Partial Electron Bulk Velocity, Despun Body Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Bulk Velocity Vector in the Despun Body Coordinate System, DBCS, during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["Vx_DBCS","Vy_DBCS","Vz_DBCS"].

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Bulk Velocity, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Bulk Velocity Vector in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["Vx_GSE","Vy_GSE","Vz_GSE"].

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Pressure Tensor, Despun Body Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Pressure Tensor in the Despun Body Coordinate System, DBCS, during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. * Column 3 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3тип3 Matrix is represented as Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Pressure Tensor, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Pressure Tensor in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. * Column 3 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3тип3 Matrix is represented as Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Temperature Tensor, Despun Body Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Temperature Tensor in the Despun Body Coordinate System, DBCS, during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. * Column 3 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3тип3 matrix is represented as Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Temperature Tensor, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
Partial Electron Temperature Tensor in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates during this Burst.
* Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. * Column 3 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3тип3 matrix is represented as Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Parallel Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Partial Electron Parallel Temperature during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Partial Electron Perpendicular Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Partial Electron Perpendicular Temperature during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Recommended Energy Index
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Recommended Energy Index during this Burst, the Energy Index is an Integer ranging from 0 to 31

Parameter.Name: Burst Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energies
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Burst Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energy Table Values
Parameter.Caveats: Energies (Parities 0/1) in the 64-Step FPI Energy Table

Parameter.Name: Burst Sky Map Delta Energies
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Burst Sky Map Delta Energy Table Values
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. These Energy Bin Centers do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by FPI at a given Energy Step.

Parameter.Name: Mean Spacecraft Potential
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Direction Unit Vector, Bhat, Despun Body Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Direction Unit Vector, Bhat, in the Despun Body Coordinate System, DCBS
Parameter.Caveats: Magnetic Field Direction Unit Vector specifying the Direction used for Pitch Angle Determination

Parameter.Name: Despun Body Coordinate System to Geocentric Solar Ecliptic Transformation Matrix
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Despun Body Coordinate System, DBCS, to Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinate System Transformation Matrix
Parameter.Caveats: Matrix used to transform from DBCS Coordinates to GSE Coordinates
